title: Natchez Trace Parkway: Multimedia Presentations
body: Explore This Park    Learn About the Park     Photos & Multimedia     Multimedia Presentations               Videos       Parkway Videos                        Changes in Latitude Explore the wide variety of natural resources found along the Natchez Trace Parkway.   Duration:7 minutes                                 Experiencing the Trace The Natchez Trace Parkway is more than a scenic drive. Discover the many recreational opportunities that can be found along the way.  Duration:5 minutes, 19 seconds                                Kaintucks on the Old Trace Kaintucks traveled down the Ohio and Mississippi Rivers to sell their goods in markets in New Orleans and Natchez. They traveled home along a trail they helped make famous: the Old Natchez Trace.  Duration:4 minutes, 48 seconds                                Sacred Sites Once common in the eastern half of the United States, most prehistoric American Indian mounds have been destroyed. Five mound sites remain on the Natchez Trace Parkway; discover what these ancient monuments mean to the descendants of those who built them.  Duration:5 minutes, 12 seconds                                The Last Days of Meriwether Lewis Meriwether Lewis, of the Lewis & Clark Corps of Discovery, died while traveling on the Old Natchez Trace in 1809. He is buried at milepost 385.9. Find out about his final days.  Duration:4 minutes, 29 seconds               Audio Described Videos For people with sight difficulties, click here for audio described versions of the videos.         Videos from Our Partners                       Protecting What is Sacred The relationship between the respected Old Ones and the modern Chickasaw people is explored in this video about the mounds of the Natchez Trace Parkway and the Native American Graves and Repatriation Act.   Duration:10 minutes, 42 seconds                                Choctaw Traditional Dances Students from the Mississippi Band of Choctaw Indians at Choctaw Central High School, participated in the creation of this video depicting traditional Choctaw dances. The was done in conjunction with a join project with the Natchez Trace Parkway. (Please note there is a short lead-in time for this video.)  Duration:9 minutes, 35 seconds
